abstract.t: The Web Real-Time Communication (WebRTC) working group is in charge to provide protocols support for direct interactive rich communication using audio, video, and data between two peers' web-browsers. This document specifies an actual (minor) protocol for how the JS-layer dataChannel objects.

section.title: Introduction
section.t: The Datagram Channel Protocol is designed to provide, in the WebRTC context , a generic transport service allowing Web Browser to exchange generic data in a peer to peer way. As discussed in the protocol uses Stream Control Transmission Protocol (SCTP) encapsulated on Datagram Transport Layer Security (DTLS) to benefit from their transport and security already standardized features.

section.title: Opening handshake
section.t: The opening handshake is based on the multimedia session description exchange that happens between the browsers through the Web Server acting as the signaling service.
The draft define the protocol identifier, 'SCTP/DTLS', and define how establishing an SCTP association over DTLS using the Session Description Protocol (SDP).
